= argument =
 field: string '''argument''' (Read-only)

The '''argument''' field contains the text that follows the command name when a player types a command.

== Description ==
Returns the argument string of the command that triggered the DIL program. This variable contains the text that follows the command name when a player types a command.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Access !! Type !! Description
|-
| argument || string || The argument string provided by the player after the command name
|}

== Return Value ==
Returns a string:
* '''string''' - The argument string provided by the player after the command name
* '''empty string''' - If no argument was provided

== Examples ==
=== Basic Command Processing ===
 dilbegin hello_command();
 code
 {
    wait(SFB_CMD, command("hello"));
    if (argument == "") {
       send("Hello there!");
    } else {
       send("Hello " + argument + "!");
    }
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Target Selection ===
 dilbegin give_command();
 var
    target_name : string;
    target : unitptr;
 code
 {
    wait(SFB_CMD, command("give") and (self == target));
    target_name := argument;
    target := findunit(self.outside, target_name, FIND_UNIT_SURRO, null);
    if (target != null and target.type == UNIT_ST_PC) {
       send("You give item to " + target.name + ".");
    } else {
       send("No one here by that name.");
    }
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Text Validation ===
 dilbegin engrave_command();
 var
    text : string;
    maxlength : integer;
 code
 {
    wait(SFB_DONE, command("say"));
    text := argument;
    maxlength := 20;
    if (length(text) > maxlength) {
       exec("say That text is too long!", self);
    } else {
       exec("say Engraving: '" + text + "'", self);
    }
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Argument Parsing ===
 dilbegin parse_arguments();
 var
    words : stringptr;
    first_word : string;
 code
 {
    wait(SFB_CMD, command("tell"));
    words := getwords(argument);
    first_word := getword(words, 0);
    send("First word of argument: " + first_word);
    quit;
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The argument variable is only meaningful when used within DIL programs triggered by commands (SFB_CMD)
* It contains everything after the command name, including spaces
* If no argument is provided, argument returns an empty string
* Commonly used to parse player input for commands like "say", "tell", "give", etc.
* The argument can be processed using string functions like getwords(), split(), etc.
* This field is read-only and automatically set by the DIL runtime system

== Error Handling ==
The field performs validation:
* '''Automatic validation'' - The field is automatically set by the DIL runtime
* '''Context validation'' - Only meaningful when accessed within command-triggered DIL programs
* '''Type validation'' - Always returns a string (may be empty)
